main_definition: Swing refers to a rhythmic back-and-forth or side-to-side motion, often used in various contexts such as physical movement, sports, and expressions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A physical action where an object or person moves back and forth repeatedly
meanings_and_examples.example: The children were playing on the swing set at the park.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used in golf to describe a shot that curves from left to right (for right-handed players) due to an improper swing or external factors
meanings_and_examples.example: He managed to hit a perfect swing and got the ball straight on landing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used in music when referring to the movement of a musical instrument, like a pendulum-like motion, often associated with jazz or blues
meanings_and_examples.example: The saxophonist demonstrated his skillful swing during the performance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An expression describing an uncertain situation that can change in either direction; it's up to chance whether things improve or worsen
meanings_and_examples.example: With the new policies, we are at a tipping point. It could swing either way for our company.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used when referring to public opinion or trends that can change in favor of one side or another
meanings_and_examples.example: The political candidate's popularity started to swing after the successful speech he delivered.
